module.title: faighnich
module.p: faighnich is a (regular) verb with the basic meaning of ask (a question). When used in the progressive it often has the extended meaning ask oneself, wonder.
When used non-progressively (i.e. in a perfective clause), iarr generally carries the meaning ask (somebody) a question.

ol.li: Direct question, e.g. Dh’fhaignich mi, “Ciamar a tha thu?” I asked, “How are you?”
Indirect question, e.g. Dh’fhaignich mi ciamar a bha i I asked how she was

module.p: See also: iarr ask for something

box.title: faighnich + direct question
box.p: In narrative, faighnich is often used to introduce a direct, reported question –
The addressee can be introduced with the preposition do –

box.title: faighnich + indirect question
box.p: faighnich is often used to introduce an indirect, embedded question –

module.p: When used progressively, (bi) a’ faighneachd generally carries the extended meaning ask oneself, wonder.
For example, Tha mi a’ faighneachd ciamar a tha i I wonder how she is.

box.title: (bi) a’ faighneachd
box.p: In the progressive, (bi) a’ faighneachd can carry the extended meaning ask oneself, wonder –
